intro: Triumfetta macrocalyx, commonly known as the large-flowered triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a hairy texture. Triumfetta macrocalyx is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in full sun to partial shade.
